verses.roman:
jaguḥ kinnara-gandharvās
tuṣṭuvuḥ siddha-cāraṇāḥ
vidyādharyaś ca nanṛtur
apsarobhiḥ samaṁ mudā

synonyms: jaguḥ—recited auspicious songs; kinnara-gandharvāḥ—the Kinnaras and Gandharvas, inhabitants of various planets in the heavenly planetary system; tuṣṭuvuḥ—offered their respective prayers; siddha-cāraṇāḥ—the Siddhas and Cāraṇas, other inhabitants of the heavenly planets; vidyādharyaḥ ca—and the Vidyādharīs, another group of inhabitants of the heavenly planets; nanṛtuḥ—danced in transcendental bliss; apsarobhiḥ—the Apsarās, beautiful dancers in the heavenly kingdom; samam—along with; mudā—in great jubilation.
translation: The Kinnaras and Gandharvas began to sing auspicious songs, the Siddhas and Cāraṇas offered auspicious prayers, and the Vidyādharīs, along with the Apsarās, began to dance in jubilation.
